block.comment: We need to reset the state of the Arduino on script start, which requires restarting it. The easiest way to do this is to disconnect the Arduino and require the user to press the connect button again.

custom-block.s: if %txt can be parsed as %upvar %upvar %cs else %cs

custom-block.comment: This broadcasts the message to all other listeners so they can handle the message.
This section parses and updates the tracked version of the device application protocol. Once the full version is received, the script knows it is ready to do other stuff.
This section tries to establish a handshake with the device and waits until the device completes the handshake before proceeding.
This defines the sequence of commands to repeat. Numbers specify amounts of time to pause, while everything else must be a message.
This steps through the sequence element-by-element and executes it. Before sending a motor command, it first waits until the previous command has completed (signaled by the "ready" global variable).

custom-block.s: if %txt can be parsed as %upvar %upvar %cs else %cs

block.comment: This section handles incoming reports of the stopped position of the pipettor and sets the "ready" global variable to indicate that a command has finished executing.
This section handles incoming messages from the pipettor and vertical positioner.

block-definition.comment: LABEL will stamp text on the stage at the given font size. The direction of the text is the direction the sprite is facing, and color will match the pen color.

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), context = stage.penTrails().getContext('2d'), rotation = radians(this.direction() - 90), trans = new Point( this.center().x - stage.left(), this.center().y - stage.top() ), isWarped = this.Warped, len, pos; if (isWarped) {endWarp(); } context.save(); context.font = size + 'px monospace'; context.textAlign = 'left'; context.textBaseline = 'alphabetic'; context.fillStyle = this.color.toString(); len = context.measureText(text).width; trans = trans.multiplyBy(1 / stage.scale); context.translate(trans.x, trans.y); context.rotate(rotation); context.fillText(text, 0, 0); context.translate(-trans.x, -trans.y); context.restore(); pos = new Point( len * Math.sin(radians(this.direction())), len * Math.cos(radians(this.direction()))); pos = pos.add(new Point(this.xPosition(), this.yPosition())); this.gotoXY(pos.x, pos.y, false); this.changed(); if (isWarped) {this.startWarp(); } stage.changed();

block-definition.comment: Takes any number of numbers as inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports the result of adding them all, so ISUM (4) (100) (8)) reports 112.
Takes any number of numbers as inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports the result of multiplying them all, so (PRODUCT (4) (100) (8)) reports 3200.

Takes any number of Boolean (true/false) inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports TRUE only if all of the inputs are TRUE, otherwise FALSE. Like AND but for multiple inputs.
Takes any number of Boolean (true/false) inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports TRUE if at least one input is TRUE, otherwise FALSE.

block-definition.s: if %'message' can be parsed as %'channel' %'payload' %'onSuccess' else %'onError'

block.l: var array = string.split('').map(function (char) { return char.charCodeAt(0) }); array.unshift(15); this.arduino.board.sysexCommand(array);

var arduino = this.arduino; arduino.board.messageHandler = messageHandler; arduino.board.onReceivedMessage = function(message) { if (message.length === 0) { arduino.board.receivedHandshake = true; } else { invoke(messageHandler, new List([message])); } }; try { arduino.board.sysexResponse(0x0F, function(data) { var decoded = String.fromCharCode.apply(null, data); arduino.board.onReceivedMessage(decoded); }); } catch (error) { }
